assessmentItem.title: Find the mean of a list of values

div.p: Find the mean of the following set of values:
Give your answer correct to 1 decimal place.

feedbackBlock.p: You have had three attempts at answering this question, so here is the solution:
The sum of these values is

To find the mean, we divide the sum of the values by the number of values:
Mean
=
Σ
i = 1
n
x n
n
=
iSum iN
=
fMean
=
fAns
( to 1 d.p.)
\begin{eqnarray*}\mbox{Mean} &=& \frac{\Sigma_{i=1}^{n}x_n}{n}\\ &=& \frac{\qv{iSum}} {\qv{iN}}\\ &=& \qv{fMean}\\ &=& \qv{fAns}\mbox{( to 1 d.p.)} \end{eqnarray*}
Divide the sum of the values by the number of values to get the mean.
Since you have viewed the solution, your score for this question will be 0.
Since you have viewed the hint, your score for this question will be halved.
